snippet: The fantasy novel has drawn comparisons to several of the biggest publishing blockbusters of the last decade, including “The Hunger Games” and “Harry Potter.”
abstract: Media Decoder column; Penguin young adult imprint Razorbill is set to announce that it has acquired sequel to Sabaa Tahir debut novel An Ember in the Ashes, which has reached No 2 spot on The New York Times young adult best-seller list since its publication in April.
lead_paragraph: The fantasy novel has drawn comparisons to several of the biggest publishing blockbusters of the last decade, including “The Hunger Games” and “Harry Potter.”

headline.main: Success of ‘An Ember in the Ashes’ Leads Publisher to a Sequel
headline.print_headline: Success of Fantasy Novel Leads Publisher to a Sequel
